metadata.Title: CVE-2022-25310 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A segmentation fault (SEGV) flaw was found in the Fribidi package and affects the fribidi_remove_bidi_marks() function of the lib/fribidi.c file. This flaw allows an attacker to pass a specially crafted file to Fribidi, leading to a crash and causing a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25310` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libfribidi-bin - 1.0.8-2ubuntu0.1
libfribidi0 - 1.0.8-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: rayveldkamp> For bionic affected function is in fribidi-deprecated.c

criterions.comment: fribidi package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.8-2ubuntu0.1').
